file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 77-21-01-04 - THERMOCOUPLES - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL THERMOCOUPLES - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the thermocouples. B. These procedures are applicable to the LH and RH engines. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 77-21-01-000-801-A THERMOCOUPLES - REMOVAL ALL 77-21-01-400-801-A THERMOCOUPLES - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 77-21-01 Page 1 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 77-21-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. THERMOCOUPLES - REMOVAL A. General (1) To remove the thermocouples, obey the instructions in Rolls-Royce MM CSP 34022. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 71-11-01-000-801-A/400 ENGINE UPPER COWLING - REMOVAL AMM TASK 71-12-01-000-802-A/400 ENGINE LOWER COWLING - REMOVAL Rolls-Royce MM CSP 34022 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 413 Lower cowling LH Engine 423 Lower cowling RH Engine 412 Upper cowling LH Engine 422 Upper cowling RH Engine D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the engine 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 2 Do the task Engine EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 77-21-01 Page 2 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO THE PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO THE MATERIAL. (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the circuit breakers below and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them. • START 1/2. (2) Put the workstand in the work area. (3) Remove the lower cowling (AMM TASK 71-12-01-000-802-A/400). (4) Remove the upper cowling (AMM TASK 71-11-01-000-801-A/400). J. Removal SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the thermocouples. Refer to the latest revision of Rolls-Royce MM CSP 34022. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 77-21-01 Page 3 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 77-21-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. THERMOCOUPLES - INSTALLATION A. General (1) To install the thermocouples, obey the instructions in Rolls-Royce MM CSP 34022. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 71-11-01-400-801-A/400 ENGINE UPPER COWLING - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 71-12-01-400-802-A/400 ENGINE LOWER COWLING - INSTALLATION Rolls-Royce MM CSP 34022 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 413 Lower cowling LH Engine 423 Lower cowling RH Engine 412 Upper cowling LH Engine 422 Upper cowling RH Engine D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the engine 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 2 Do the task Engine I. Installation SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the thermocouples. Refer to the latest revision of Rolls-Royce MM CSP 34022. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 77-21-01 Page 4 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the upper cowling (AMM TASK 71-11-01-400-801-A/400). (2) Install the lower cowling (AMM TASK 71-12-01-400-802-A/400). (3) Remove the workstand. (4) On the circuit breaker panel, close the circuit breakers below and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from them. • START 1/2. (5) Refer to the Rolls-Royce MM CSP 34022 to do the related check procedures after an engine LRU maintenance procedure, as applicable. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 77-21-01 Page 5 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
